DataElement.preferredDefinition: information relating to a prior (earlier in time or order) solid (the state in which a substance retains a definite size and shape) neoplasm (tumor; an abnormal mass of tissue that results from excessive cell division) and the personal medical history of a person._The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Person Prior Solid Neoplasm Personal Medical History
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information relating to a prior (earlier in time or order) solid (the state in which a substance retains a definite size and shape) neoplasm (tumor; an abnormal mass of tissue that results from excessive cell division) and the personal medical history of a person.

Property.preferredName: Prior Solid Neoplasm Personal Medical History
Property.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order.:The state in which a substance has no tendency to flow under moderate stress; resists forces (such as compression) that tend to deform it; and retains a definite size and shape.:(NEE-o-PLAY-zha) Abnormal and uncontrolled cell growth.:an account of all medical events and problems a person has experienced.

Concepts.definition: The state in which a substance has no tendency to flow under moderate stress; resists forces (such as compression) that tend to deform it; and retains a definite size and shape.

A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.
A record of a patient's background regarding health and the occurrence of disease events of the individual. In addition, personal medical history may be a variable in epidemiologic studies.

ConceptualDomain.preferredName: Chronic or Associated Diseases and Exposures
ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: chronic diseases, as well as diseases and exposures associated with cancer.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.
